channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: As predicted by C.H. Waddington back in the 1940s/early '50s, before it was even known that genetic information was encoded in DNA. He is also coined the terms "epigenetics" and "epigenetic landscape" (below) before it was cool. https://t.co/ZVnb90pi88 https://t.co/4j9jNPQKCH https://t.co/uefAOHQjK6
item.source:markdown: As predicted by C.H. Waddington back in the 1940s/early '50s, before it was even known that genetic information was encoded in DNA. He is also coined the terms "epigenetics" and "epigenetic landscape" (below) before it was cool. https://t.co/ZVnb90pi88 https://t.co/4j9jNPQKCH https://t.co/uefAOHQjK6

item.description:
@barttels2 @cecilejanssens I did miss it…

What a terrible loss. May she rest in peace.

item.description:
@amfibolije Deljenje takvih mapa je bolji test inteligencije od bilo kog IQ testa.

A bilo koga sa tim blesavim teorijama o IQ treba uputiti na ovaj Talebov tekst https://t.co/XkNfceIf6I.
item.source:markdown:

item.description: @barttels2 @cecilejanssens Oh my, I had no idea. Wishing you a boring and uneventful course!
item.source:markdown: @barttels2 @cecilejanssens Oh my, I had no idea. Wishing you a boring and uneventful course!

item.description:
Is PCA as sensitive to small perturbations when used in CyTOF, RNA-Seq, etc. as it is in population genetics? If no, why not? If yes, ouch! https://t.co/jM5UyRqHph https://t.co/mUKPlxs7TY

The author has a blog, and he pulls no punches. https://t.co/rMTIgbojAT

Hat tip to @nntaleb who's been yelling into clouds for years that models that give drastically different results after small perturbations to the input aren't worth the bits they're stored on. https://t.co/DhupIBH36f

And by "for years" I mean since at least 2019, when he pointed to the exact same problem with PCA (I think; this is higher level of math than I can interpret). https://t.co/BEORgL7TlT
item.source:markdown:
Is PCA as sensitive to small perturbations when used in CyTOF, RNA-Seq, etc. as it is in population genetics? If no, why not? If yes, ouch! https://t.co/jM5UyRqHph https://t.co/mUKPlxs7TY
The author has a blog, and he pulls no punches. https://t.co/rMTIgbojAT
Hat tip to @nntaleb who's been yelling into clouds for years that models that give drastically different results after small perturbations to the input aren't worth the bits they're stored on. https://t.co/DhupIBH36f
And by "for years" I mean since at least 2019, when he pointed to the exact same problem with PCA (I think; this is higher level of math than I can interpret). https://t.co/BEORgL7TlT
